title: Christy Mathewson
summary: Christopher Mathewson (August 12, 1880 – October 7, 1925), nicknamed "Big Six", "The Christian Gentleman", "Matty", and "The Gentleman's Hurler", was a Major League Baseball  right-handed pitcher, who played 17 seasons with the New York Giants. He stood 6 ft 1 in (1.85 m) tall and weighed 195 pounds (88 kg). He was among the most dominant pitchers in baseball history,  and ranks in the all-time top 10 in several key pitching categories, including wins, shutouts, and ERA.[1]  In 1936, Mathewson was elected into the Baseball Hall of Fame as one of its first five members.
